Module JBubbleBobble2
Package BubbleBobble.model

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
BubbleBobble.model.Collidable
BubbleBobble.model.Monster
Direct Known Subclasses:
BubbleBuster, Giant, Incendo
public abstract class Monster extends Collidable
The Monster abstract class defines the basic characteristics of any monster type in the game, including platform collisions, movement, and interactions with other game objects (e.g., Hero, Bubble, FireBubble).

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster(Level level, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Constructor to initialize a Monster with a given position and size in the level.
      Parameters:
      level - The level this monster belongs to.
      x - The x-coordinate of the monster.
      y - The y-coordinate of the monster.
      width - The width of the monster.
      height - The height of the monster.

  • Method Details

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the monster's position based on its current movement state, including jumping and gravity effects.
      Specified by:
      updatePosition in class Collidable

    • collideWithPlatform

      public void collideWithPlatform(Platform p)
      Handles the collision of the monster with a platform. The monster changes direction when it collides with a platform.
      Overrides:
      collideWithPlatform in class Collidable
      Parameters:
      p - The platform that the monster collided with.

    • determineMovement

      public void determineMovement()
      Determines the monster's movement based on the location of the Hero and random probabilities. The monster may jump or change direction periodically.

    • updateHeroLocation

      public void updateHeroLocation(Point2D heroLocation1)
      Updates the monster's knowledge of the hero's location.
      Parameters:
      heroLocation1 - The location of the hero.

    • changeDirection

      public void changeDirection()
      Gives the monster a 20% chance of changing direction. The direction is reversed, and the sprite direction is updated accordingly.

    • collideWithBubble

      public void collideWithBubble()
      Handles the situation when the monster is hit by a bubble. The monster becomes bubbled and starts rising upwards. After a delay based on its current height, the monster will un-bubble itself.

    • collideWithFireBubble

      public void collideWithFireBubble(int type, Level level)
      Handles collision with a FireBubble. The monster dies upon collision, and points are awarded based on the type of FireBubble (Hero or Player 2).
      Parameters:
      type - The type of FireBubble (1 for Hero, 2 for Player 2).
      level - The current level of the game.

    • changeSpriteDirection

      public void changeSpriteDirection()
      Changes the sprite direction based on the monster's current movement direction. The sprite is updated to reflect the direction of movement.
